snippet: Contrary to popular belief, most Americans who use prepaid cards also have checking accounts.
abstract: Your Money Adviser column on how prepaid debit cards, often thought of as alternative for people who cannot qualify for traditional checking accounts, are becoming popular way to augment banking for many consumers; research from Pew Charitable Trusts shows that many Americans use cards to help manage money and stick to budget.
lead_paragraph: Contrary to popular belief, most Americans who use prepaid cards also have checking accounts.

headline.main: Prepaid Debit Cards May Augment Bank Accounts
headline.print_headline: Prepaid Debit Cards May Augment Bank Accounts
